key_mistakes.reason: This move allows Black to gain tempo by attacking the bishop with a pawn, and it also fails to apply pressure on the center.
Developing the knight to c6 blocks the c-pawn and allows White to gain a strong central and active position.
This move does not contribute to central control or development and can be easily refuted by simple development from Black.
Castling into an open line with many attacking pieces is dangerous, allowing White to build a strong attack.
The knight move to e4 places it into a vulnerable position and can be easily attacked or exchanged, leading to a loss of tempo.
This move weakens the queenside unnecessarily and allows White to seize control of the c5 square.

recommendations: Focus on controlling the center with your pawns and pieces.
Develop your pieces quickly and efficiently, aiming for harmony and activity.
Ensure king safety before launching an attack.
Consider pawn structure when making exchanges or pawn moves.
